sentence: Lately for the past few weeks I've noticed the tip of my tongue goes numbfor seconds at a time, only while I'm speaking.
I made a 4 hr flight in europe last week to the canary islands in spain on landing 24hrs later I had bad earache and loss of hearing .
Had a fever for a night then had nasal congestion, sore throat.
A week afterwards I noticed my tongue turned yellow.
I have blisters or sores in the back of my throat.
I think I am starting to have a slight loss of hearing in my left ear.
Immediately after the explosion I realized I had loss some hearing from that ear.
I get hot flashes, sinus pressure, bleching and bloating and earaches like fullness in the ears from time to time.
Lately while listening to certain songs with high treble my eyes begin to water and I get some discomfort in my ears.
My ex is 50 years old and is coughing up blood a little bit in mucus and has happened three times in a row.
A friend have a 4 years old daughter who lost hearing from one ear suddenly, she woke up in the morning completely deaf.
When she was about 2 years old she lost hearing from the other ear.
My hearing has been getting progressively more sensitive, and is driving me crazy.
My left ear feels clogged.
I've been suffering from occasional voice loss for two months now.
Over the past two days I noticed an irritating sensation in the back of my throat, as if there was something stuck.
Went to sleep with a mild neck pain on the right side.
Woke up with the same neck pain, plus a severe case of dizziness and slight loss of hearing.
Same symptoms with a more severe loss of hearing and a numbness of the right-side of tongue and ear lobes.
Has sudden attacks of a blocked right ear, followed by severe dizziness, which leads to severe vomiting and cold sweats.
Recently I was taken to the ER with a severe pressure in my face and head and dizziness.
I was short of breath and had some minimal chest pain.
I have a lump in my nose it is only about 1/2cm-1cm inside the nostril cavity.
I occasionally get blood noses.
Added ontop over the past couple of months I have suffered from more headaches then normal, I am more tired, at night my nose goes numb.
I woke up yesterday morning with the area under my right eye puffy and my eyelid a little puffy just right above my inner eye.
Last night I discovered a lump in front of my ear on the same side of my face.
I started having sinus pressure in my head.
I have a currently found a lump on the left side of my neck, just below my ear.
I have suffer from spontaneous nosebleed often.
About 4 days ago I devolped this clicking and popping noise in my throat on the right side while swallowing.
I had a slight sore throat last week and it has since went away.
I've had a headache across my forehead and in the spot where I hit it last week.
I have sneezing fits randomly through the day and then it'll end up with a runny nose and itching eyes.
I am trying to figure out what's causing my earache, fuzzy hearing, sensitivity to noise, and feeling of fullness and pressure inside my ear.
The symptoms are similar to those of Meniere's, but I don't experience any extreme vertigo, just light dizziness at times.
I've had a constant need to clear my throat and excessive phlegm in my throat.
Just recently I've also been experiencing really thick, sticky saliva and a dry mouth, which makes it hard to swallow...
The back right side of my tongue feels sore when I swallow or move it around.
Throat has been itching for awhile now and starting to hurt.
Just feels like I have a sore throat.
She's been having nosebleeds each night for the past 3 nights.
Full and runny nose and cough.
I started geting a dull ache in my left ear and it hurt to touch.
I have had a dry persistent cough for going on 8 months now.
I went to my doctor about a week ago because of lightheadedness, dizziness, headache, and eye twitching.
My biggest problem now is fatigue, almost as if my head is so heavy.
I have a dry persistent cough only in the morning for 5 to 10 min.
Several times a year I have a spot in the rear of my mouth that gets very sore.
I started getting sharp stabbing pains in my neck.
Shortly afterwards the glands in my neck became swollen and I had frequent sore throats and fatigue.
